text: well hey hi everyone drink the ET Tano
here the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
M83 album fantasy M83 is the musical
project of multi-instrumentalist singer
producer and songwriter Mr Anthony
Gonzalez this is his ninth studio album
I believe and essentially this is the
long-awaited follow-up to the 2016 album
junk which I was not crazy about myself
as even the singles from this thing to
me felt kind of overblown lacking in
Direction and maybe even a little silly
in my opinion much of m83's recent
material has reflected the sound of a
project that has lost its way since
reaching a commercial Peak with the
intergalactic sounds of hurry upward
dreaming in 2011. but the 2000s run
before that resulted in a pretty great
series of sweet dreamy synth pop records
that had a nice balance of texture
effects and songwriting but these days
that's more or less been replaced by the
sound of Gonzalez constructing the
biggest sound out of the most basic and
forgettable ideas that and he's been
working on a lot of soundtracks and
instrumental music even dropping a new
AG follow-up to digital Shades volume 1
back in 2019 which went relatively
unnoticed yes but was still an
accomplishment when you consider the
increase in richness and texture and
instrumentation from one volume to the
next really showed how far Anthony came
as an artist over the past decade in
terms of his capabilities and influences
but with that being the case though I
have to ask why does fantasy only sound
like a slight Improvement on junk for
one the record kicks off with a really
tedious instrumental tone Setter with an
acoustic guitar that doesn't evoke much
followed by a synthesizer layers that
sound like an Intergalactic blender
droning into Oblivion and the following
Ocean's Niagara feels like it's kind of
building up to something too sure it's
got a Groove and some shimmering lead
Melodies and more layers to it but it
doesn't sound like a song so much as it
sounds like the theme to a show about a
bunch of color-coded Japanese space
robots that fight for their Planet using
the power of friendship and it's called
squishbots at least the record is living
up to the title I suppose though I don't
think the immersion of this fantasy runs
super deep which I think can be said for
much of the album from here as well and
don't get me wrong because as we go
deeper into the record I think Gonzalez
showcases a myriad of respectable
influences from Progressive electronic
music to New Age New Wave a bit of Neo
psych and some synth pop too the first
properly structured song on the entire
LP Amnesia I would even say has this
hypnotic repetition of trout Rock
grooves some quirky mgmt-esque
indietronica 2 as well as the kind of
big panoramic vocal displays you get off
of a Polyphonic Spree record there is
potential here in this tune and in this
unique Confluence of sounds it's just a
shame that it comes off so washed out
and Toothless because of the overuse of
Reverb the following us and the rest
leaves me feeling like I'm being slowly
indoctrinated into a space cult via a
glistening synth Odyssey dream sequence
with a super overblown Crescendo at the
end which is not really that gratifying
as there wasn't a whole lot of tension
built up to that point anyway then on
Earth to see some new wave Vibes kind of
take a foothold on the track but the
Sonic said progression of the song are
so bloated any pop appeal they might
have gets completely smothered in
tedious pacing and this blindingly
bright Haze it's not nearly as wondrous
as it's convinced it is which is how I'd
characterize some other key moments on
the record as well like sunny boy which
was it really so killer that it required
a two-minute reprise just a track later
on top of that to the record itself need
a several minute interlude in the middle
of it that just kind of adds to the
generally formless and soupy sound all
the songs have fallen into so far the
first half of this LP in my opinion is a
real drag it's not really until the
second half that we get some real
highlights and shake-ups deceiver for
example is a decent enough Progressive
electronic piece for most of it it's
actually kind of settle in its pacing
and initial approach with a lot of sweet
analog synths it's a little Eerie it's
got a simple beat too while it's nothing
groundbreaking I'm feeling the fantasy a
bit more on this one then on the title
track which is nearly as washed out as
anything else on here we do actually get
some standout lead Melodies plus the
grooves on this one feel more geared
toward the Dance Floor surprisingly
which is definitely a change of pace
from the overwhelming Shimmer of every
other song on the record Laura kind of
sounds like a beach house and Peter
Gabriel collaboration which is
absolutely a unique combo but neither
artist is really bringing their best
vocal game in this scenario cool Nui
stood out to me as a highlight as well
mostly because of how mysterious and
Eerie the instrumental sounds mostly
thanks to its dark Vibes its mysterious
vocal passages and throbbing synths and
then the closing track which is super
lengthy does feature some interesting
ideas stunning chord progressions some
vocoder vocals too the track shines in
this Epic thick and futuristic way like
something off of Daft Punk's Random
Access Memories but with the piece
moving at a sloth's Pace it's not nearly
as gripping as we move from section to
section in the song there's a lot of
Journey on this track but not a lot of
Thrills I guess outside of this
deafening and over Reverb wall of sound
toward the very end of the song which
isn't exactly novel at this point
because how much instrumentation like
this have we heard on the album for the
past hour it doesn't feel like a special
moment it doesn't feel stand out it adds
more to the uniformity of the lp than
anything look overall I enjoyed this
record more than I did junk from a while
back it's more cohesive consistent
tasteful less goofy but still most of
the songs on this thing drag on to the
point where they get in the way of their
own potential plus the album itself
isn't interesting or varied enough to
justify all the bloat it has either much
of the Reverb and effects on these
tracks are deafening and suck the flavor
out of the instrumentation which is a
shame because so many of the
instrumentals and mixes on digital
Shades volume two were so good really
good there's not a single track on this
thing that sounds as clear Rich mature
or vibrant as lundifil for example and
while fantasy in comparison does have
more of a pop appeal have more of a
songwriting element going on sonically
it just feels kind of dumbed down I'm
feeling a light five on this LP
transition have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
but would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should I review
next hit the like if you like Please
Subscribe and please don't cry hit the
Bell as well over here next to my head
is another video that you can check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel Anthony fantano M83 forever
